In general, the AI doesn't like to take on guarded transports without good odds and 2 BB's are long odds.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, if those are the only places where naval units are found, then the AI will go for them. That's why you should be producing transports for use strictly as bait. Load them up as they are built with a single low-value unit and just send them into the deep blue seas. Losing them keeps the AI navy busy elsewhere while you truck in dozens of new units. To sustain an assault, airlifts alone aren't enough unless you want a grinding war.[PARAGRAPH:1]Also remember that the transports have enough attack points that if there is a severely injured BB or destroyer hanging around, feel free to just take him out with an empty transport.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Air Warfare[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Most of the strategy articles talk about Stealth Bomber, but that is at the end of the tech tree. Surely people have gone to war while armed strictly with Tanks, Artillery, Infantry, and Bombers [PARAGRAPH:1]In the Industrial Era, the Bomber is of limited utility. It takes at least 6 attacks to reduce a 100% cultural defense down to zero, and that assumes you can obtain a good base. You'll spend a lot of time rebasing bombers, because a base suitable for assaulting one city won't be suitable for another. Given how much the AI likes to use SAM Infantry, the Bomber is in deadly danger as soon as they have Rocketry, which comes a LOT sooner than Stealth Bomber. The Bomber is also relatively worthless in an air strike role unless the enemy AI is so far behind as to NOT have SAM Infantry or Fighters. [PARAGRAPH:1]At Prince or above, how likely is it that an AI which you'd have to plan a trans-oceanic assault on doesn't have SAM Infantry [PARAGRAPH:1]In short, Bombers are almost a complete waste of time in the city assault role. You'd be better off using the production capacity to produce an artillery [PARAGRAPH:1]Fighters are also nearly completely worthless. They spend too much time trying to re-base as operations move forward, and the production is better spent on another SAM Infantry or Mech. Infantry unit if you wanted anti-air protection. Unlike fighters, those units are actually useful for something else.[PARAGRAPH:2]The only air unit even worth building is the Stealth Bomber, which is of course set to be wayyyy too powerful. With a big stack of stealth bombers (12+) not even a city protected by Jet Fighters can reasonable hope to protect it from bombardment. As long as you rest the Stealth Bombers to heal any time they take damage, you can expect to lose less than 1-in-10 even after 40+ rounds of combat. There's no need to discuss how to use these.[PARAGRAPH:1][H1]Tactics[NEWLINE][\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]Some random thoughts, in no particular order[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Dealing with Gunships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sending out any kind of an armor force of Tanks or even Modern Armor without protection is an open invitation for AI gunships to swoop in, and as discussed, the AI always has a lot of gunships since they are upgrades from Cavalry. How to deal with them[PARAGRAPH:2]A lot of people like to use SAM Infantry, because of the 50% bonus. Bad idea. Even with the bonus, they don't measure up to the Mech Infantry's attack power. And SAM Infantry can't keep up with tank units. Best to leave these guys back in your conquered cities as air cover.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you don't have the Mech Infantry unit, you should bring along extra Gunships instead. It's a fair fight, and Gunships have little combat role in the city assault anyways since they can't attack an entrenched SAM unit with any kind of success. As part of a stack with tanks, the enemy SAM Infantry can't get at them and you just need to have more Gunships than the enemy can bring the bear.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the event there are gunships covering a city, expect to spend a couple more artillery so that your own tanks have a fighting chance at beating them. Infantry against gunship is not a good deal either, and it's better to spend more artillery units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Railroad Raider[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Besides the vital necessity of creating a fire-break around your beachhead city, you should have obtained a world map at some point which gives you a look at the terrain. Look for choke points where the road network narrows and plan to drop a transport with a few gunships on that spot. Because of the 4 MP's, a gunship can unload, pillage, and get back on the transport in a single turn. [PARAGRAPH:1]Any enemy choke point which comes too close to the ocean is your prey. Stay away from squares with towns. Although the plunder is nice, it takes too long to get all the way down to the railroad.[PARAGRAPH:1]Unlike previous versions of Civ, you can't cross an entire continent on rails in a single turn. Any degradation of the rail network which causes units to detour is worth doing. A transport loaded with 4 gunships can move down the coast and blow away 2-3 squares worth of railroads in a single turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Feint[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Use the railroad movement cost to your advantage. In Civ4, it's much harder to reinforce. If you have the units, start a false landing with ONLY the crap-units you can't use (machine guns, un-upgraded cannons, old riflemen, unneeded cavalry) in an inaccessible spot near a bad city. The AI will respond in force regardless, and it'll draw all those 1 MP units too far from your actual beachhead to respond the same turn. [PARAGRAPH:1]That extra turn gives you the breathing space make sure you cut rail links. This tactic is best combined with Railroad Raider. If you draw them out and then cut the roads behind them, you can comfortably settle in before they reach you.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Research Priority[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Considering the relative useless nature of bombers, is it really necessary to research Radio early on[PARAGRAPH:1]Instead of 6k on Radio, get Rocketry first because Gunships are a lot more valuable.[PARAGRAPH:1] (a href="http://forums.civfanatics.com/showthread.phpt=163114]Discuss this article on the forum(/div)[NEWLINE](/div)[NEWLINE](/div)

[H1]On the Finer Points of Tank Warfare[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1] - by [H2]cleverhandle [\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]I love Tanks. And while I know that the diehard warmongers would consider a game that lasts long enough to see them a disgrace, I'd still like to share some thoughts about how to make the most of these lovely, rolling implements of destruction. Experienced warmongers may view much of this as obvious implications of the combat system, but hopefully there will be a few tips useful for everyone.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Significance:[\BOLD] The combination of two moves, collateral damage, and city raider allow one to capture enemy cities far more quickly than in previous eras. Conquering a city every other turn with only a modest battlegroup (i.e. 10-12 tanks) is easily possible, given the right tactics. This can have tremendous impact, whether you're a builder looking to demolish a rival or a warmonger looking for an early end date.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Objective:[\BOLD] Conquer enemy cities as [BOLD]quickly[\BOLD] as possible. At this stage of the game, IMO, losing an occasional tank is well worth cutting your conquest time by 50%-75%. The war weariness, supply costs, and wasted turns before victory are more important than a few hundred hammers. If you are significantly behind your enemy and are trying for a desperate late game power-grab, these tactics may not be appropriate.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Assumptions:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]1) You are at least close to tech/power parity with your victim. It's fine if he has gunships and/or SAM's. If he's far enough ahead to already have Jets or MechInfs, then you're probably too late.[PARAGRAPH:1]2) You have Flight and Radio (for Fighters and Bombers). Having Rocketry (for Gunships) and Robotics (for MechInfs) is nice, but by no means required. You also need Airports in your major military production cities.[PARAGRAPH:1]3) You have a reasonable supply of Level 4 (10XP) units. Just having a military city with West Point is enough - you don't need a ton of Level 4 units. Having the Pentagon and civics such that every city can produce 10XP troops is obviously nice, but again not strictly necessary.[PARAGRAPH:1]4) You're playing on Settler. Kidding... this works fine at least through Emperor, provided you can stay in the game well enough to meet the other criteria.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]What you need:[\BOLD][BOLD][NEWLINE][\BOLD][NEWLINE]Tanks: Well, duh. More specifically, you need several kinds:[PARAGRAPH:1]1) Raider Tanks - your heavy hitters: You want 3 of these, 4 is better. These are the ones that really need to be Level 4 to be effective. Take Raider I, Raider II, and Barrage I promotions. Take Raider III at Level 5 if you get there.[PARAGRAPH:1]2) Drill Tanks - cleanup crew: How many you need depends on how many troops you're up against. A number equal to the number of defending troops is safe. If you're in a time/production bind, you can reasonably count on blitzing for multiple attacks but make sure that the target city isn't on a hill (costs 2 moves to attack). Promote these with as many Drill promos as you can get.[PARAGRAPH:1]3) Cover Tanks - protection: You want 2-3 of these, depending on how much you fear the enemy's counterattack. Promote either all Combat or Combat I/II, Ambush depending on whether you think a counterattack will be heavier on tanks or artillery/gunships. If you have Gunships, one of them can replace one of these. If you have MechInfs, use them instead. On the very first assault of a war, these will take a larger beating as the AI throws its extra troops at them. For the fastest conquest, keep two extras safe behind your lines and ready to move.[PARAGRAPH:1]Non-Tank units:[PARAGRAPH:1]1) Medics - Explorers are essential for this, because they'll likely be the only available 2 move unit that can take medic. You need two of them.[PARAGRAPH:1]2) Bombers - The more the merrier, but 10 is probably enough. 15 can cut through even the toughest air defenses I've seen. More than that is overkill. Expect to lose about one for every other city and be ready to replace them.[PARAGRAPH:1]3) Fighters - Two or three flying Interception within range of the target city. Only needed if the victim has Bombers himself, in order to intercept bombing runs against your approaching stack.[PARAGRAPH:1]4) Worker pair w/cover - Very important. You need to be able to quickly build rails in conquered territory. In contrast to Civ3, the AI doesn't appear to be very keen on snagging covered workers. I tend to cover with only a single tough defender like a Combat I/II/Ambush Infantry. An extra cover unit would be safer. Having two pairs of workers is also nice, but not essential.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]How it works:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In most situations, this will be a two turn process - one to approach and the other to attack. If terrain, culture, or a reliance on blitz necessitate an extra approach turn, you may want to hold off some or all of the bombers until turn two.[PARAGRAPH:1]Turn 1:[PARAGRAPH:1]1) Tank group approaches. Since tanks don't receive terrain bonuses, you generally just want the fastest path. But sometimes you can position yourself so that incoming attacks are across a river, which is helpful.[PARAGRAPH:1]2) First bombing run - balance is key here. It's important to damage the units in the target city on this turn since the combat system significantly penalizes weakened attackers. You want counterattacking tanks, artillery, and gunships to come at you at no more than 75% strength or so. At the same time, your airstrikes won't be effective until you've lowered the culture defense, and of course you need to start softening them up for your approaching tanks anyway. Keep in mind that, at 15%/turn, it takes 7 successful bombing runs to completely eliminate enemy defenses. I tend to go about 60/40 %bombard vs. unit bombard on this turn. %bombard first, then unit bombard. If you have a surplus of air power, it's worth looking around at other cities near your target in order to weaken any responders there.[PARAGRAPH:1]Turn 2:[PARAGRAPH:1]1) Second bombing run - Finish what the first one started. You should really have enough bombers to both zero out the cultural defense and reduce all defenders to 50%. If that's impossible, go for a balanced approach. If the enemy has bunkers (which is pretty rare, in my experience), try to make sure that every unit takes a few hits but don't get hung up on it.[PARAGRAPH:1]2) Raiders attack - This wave has two objectives - take out the toughest defenders and soften up the remainder for your drill tanks. These tanks [BOLD]will[\BOLD] take damage, though hopefully not be destroyed. Do [BOLD]not[\BOLD] use every raider tank you brought. Two is enough - the goal is speed, and the more damage you suffer the more time you spend healing. After two collateral damage hits from these the rest of the defenders should be under 50% strength, and it's time to move on. The third/fourth raider tanks are purely for backup purposes in case the other two get badly beat up by counterstrikes.[PARAGRAPH:1]3) Drill tanks attack - This wave takes advantage of first strikes, letting your drill tanks sweep up defenders with a good probability of taking no damage. Nothing elaborate, just send them in. Don't blitz with a wounded tank unless absolutely required - not because you'll lose it, but because you want to minimize healing time. This wave should capture the city. If you've never tried this, expect to be surprised at how your tanks can go 5 for 5 battles or more without taking a scratch.[PARAGRAPH:1]4) Move in to the city - This gets tricky, depending on how the enemy countered your advance. If you have damaged tanks (from an artillery or air strike, perhaps) that haven't moved, you may want to leave them outside the city to get an extra turn of healing. Just make sure they're protected by one of your cover units, and keep one of the medics there of course. The AI doesn't seem terribly interested in picking off your stack provided that it's covered. Otherwise, move them in.[PARAGRAPH:1]5) Fly in a garrison - You do have a garrison infantry waiting at a friendly airport, right Your shiny new city can accept one airlifted unit each turn, even while it's revolting. Make sure you have another one for next turn, too. If you want a larger garrison, you can airlift to the nearest city and move it over via rails.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]The result:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You have a new city and a bunch of tanks that need, at most, a single skipped turn to heal. After you've weathered the initial counterstrikes in a war, it's entirely common that only your lead raider tank takes any damage at all - let that one stay behind to heal up, and the others can start their next approach on the turn after the first assault. Typical losses are 1-2 tanks and 3-4 bombers for a sustained campaign taking 6-8 cities from an enemy of roughly equal power. If your unfortunate victim doesn't have any far-flung island cities, a tank campaign along these lines can eliminate an enemy civ in under 20 turns.[PARAGRAPH:1]I think that's pretty much it. I hope these tactics prove useful in your conquests. Comments, questions, and improvements are welcomed.

[H1]Modern Naval Strategy for Beyond the Sword[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1] - by [H2]Plato90s [\H2][NEWLINE]Beyond the Sword changed many things about the game, and naval warfare was one of the most dramatically affected. The limits on aircraft units per city changed the scope, but not the basis of air warfare. The additional units in land warfare made siege units relevant again.[PARAGRAPH:1]But war at sea was completely changed. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the vanilla CIV4, naval supremacy was nice to have but not necessary. The worst that could happen from not owning the oceans was losing some fishing boats and an air strike here and there (which you could counter with land-based aircraft). After your massed stealth bombers whittle them down, a few battleships can take down entire fleets of weakened enemy ships. [PARAGRAPH:1]Cruise missiles and tactical nukes changed all that.[PARAGRAPH:1]Now, not having sea superiority means that large stretches of your interior can be devastated, and possibly even nuked. The AI also uses amphibious assaults more often, and in conjunction with missle/nuke strikes. At the same time, the equation for gaining sea power has gotten more complicated.[PARAGRAPH:1]A whole new naval strategy is needed.[PARAGRAPH:1]To start, let's cover the main units.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Missile Cruiser[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]This is going to be your main combatant. Once onboard missles are exhausted, this is just a battleship and should be used accordingly. Promotions should be for Drill 1, Drill 2, and then Barrage. The idea is that you want the MC to survive initial combat, and then start prepping the rest of the enemy fleet for destruction.[PARAGRAPH:1]You shouldn't feel the need to always have fully-loaded MC's, but rather keep a few empties around so that they can fight the battles. Once the enemy is down to ~27 strength, a Drill 2 MC should be sent in.[PARAGRAPH:1]In a protracted war at sea, expect to build (and lose) a lot of MC's.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Stealth Destroyer[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]This is a misunderstood unit in because it's NOT a replacement for the destroyer the way a MC is a replacement for Battleship in every way. This is a brand new unit, like the Attack Submarine, and needs to be used in a brand new way.[PARAGRAPH:1]Two basic role exists for Stealth Destroyers - surveillance and assassin.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the surveillance role, the SD should have Flanking and Sentry to maximize the viewing radius. Surveillance SD's (S-SD) should be deployed to make EVERY ocean square between you and your enemy visible. There can be no fog of war when it comes to naval warfare unless you want an entire fleet to sneak up on you. The specifics of how such a picket line should be ployed will be discussed later.[PARAGRAPH:1]Another use for the S-SD's is to sneak in and bombard enemy cities' cultural defenses, if your picket lines are close enough.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the assassin role, the SD should have only Drill promotions, and hold those promotions in reserve for healing injuries. Once you kill opposing SD's, your highly damaged SD's can be in the middle of the ocean but also be perfectly safe. That's why your Assassin SD's (A-SD) should be the vehicle of choice for finishing off damaged units or hunting down tranports/subs/carriers. They're the only ones who can survive the aftermath.[PARAGRAPH:1]SD's should emphatically NOT be employed in a stack with other units, the way the AI does. It doesn't buy you anything, since SD's won't defend against anything except another SD.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Attack Submarine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]This is a critical unit, because the AI really loves to use submarines to deliver tactical nukes. Once you have Stealth Destroyers, you'll need Attack Subs in order to help locate and destroy enemy submarines. [PARAGRAPH:1]Because Attack Subs should only be used against other subs or transports/carriers or heavily damaged units, it's in the same category as a S-SD and should get Flanking and Sentry. Additional promotions should be Navigation 1 and 2.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Submarine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]This is also a crucial unit because it's the way to deliver tactical nukes and additional cruise missles to a front-deployed fleet. There's no combat role for the submarine because it's not powerful enough to fight any of the late-game opponents head on.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you want missle strikes - better to deliver it from a MC, which can follow up with an attack or survive a counter-attack after getting close to enemy shores.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you want to detect/kill other subs, the Attack Sub is much better.[PARAGRAPH:1]That's why the main role of subs is to either shuttle cruise missles to re-load MC's which have fired their on-board supply or to sneak in a tactical nuke. As such, submarines receive Flanking and Navigation 1/2. Beyond that, add Sentry to help avoid threats.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Battleship[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Whatever battleships you have as of the time that MC's come along - leave them alone. There's no need to spend money upgrading BB's when they don't gain any combat power and the supply of cruise missiles always tend to trail the number of MC's on hand. [PARAGRAPH:1]Instead, use the BB's for the same role as they had in CIV4 original - escorting carriers and transports. Their MP's are perfect, once the transport/carrier has been upgraded with Navigation 1. They're just as powerful in defensive role as MC's.[PARAGRAPH:1]There's no particular need to stock up on BB's, and also no reason to change how you use them from the original CIV4. You can't see SD's or subs sneaking up on you, but that's why you have surveillance SD's and Attack Subs anyways.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Destroyers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These are critical units which should be stockpiled in large numbers. Build them while you can and NEVER upgrade them. You can always build more SD's, but the supply of destroyers you have are finite [PARAGRAPH:1]DD's have the ability to detect subs, they can move farther than the Attack Subs, and can kill the invading subs just as effectively. On top of that, they still retain their anti-air capabilities, so they're not nearly as vulnerable to air assault as the submarines.[PARAGRAPH:1]DD's also come in the same 2 varieties as SD's - surveillance or attack. Unlike SD's, surveillance-type DD's should be used to escort large fleets because it'll provide some redundant sub-spotting (and killing) capability.[PARAGRAPH:1]Otherwise, attack- and surveillance-DD's should be deployed near shorelines because they're so valuable and so vulnerable.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Carriers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In theory, carriers are much less useful than before. Air recon can't detect submarines or Stealth Destroyers, and the naval strike role which made Jet fighters valuable can now be taken over by missiles.[PARAGRAPH:1]In reality, carriers are still useful for providing first-strike on detected submarines and MC's which have been stripped of their escorts. More importantly, they have a HUGE role in one of the main purposes of the navy - supporting a beachhead.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Technically not an unit, but so crucial it deserves its own mention. With BTS, fortifications act as cities for naval and air purposes. That means new tricks which were impossible before.[PARAGRAPH:1]A naval unit can use a fort to create a land-bridge to cross an island while an enemy fleet must take the long way around. A ship can move from ocean-to-fort #1, then fort #1-to-city, then city-to-fort #2, and finally fort #2 to ocean. A crossing which might have used on the entire MP quota of a MC could instead be completed with only 4 MP's. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ocean-Fort-City-Fort-Ocean[PARAGRAPH:1]A fort can also be constructed to give you secure naval bases in stretches of your territory where it makes no sense to plant a city. [PARAGRAPH:1]A fort can be used to house fighters/bombers to help support your coastal defense.[PARAGRAPH:1]Now, if you're lucky enough to have an island off your shore, build a city on it just to be able to use it as forward air/naval station. Forts give you shortcuts to help chase down a faster enemy, and a secure way of bringing your transports further along before exposing them to attack.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Naval deployments[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several major categories of naval war strategy. [PARAGRAPH:1]You can choose to fight a defensive action, where your fleets are deployed out of home ports and are tasked with killing any unit you see. The goal is to protect your own lands while the land war continues or you're trying to prevent a landing. [PARAGRAPH:1]There's also the offensive approach, where you bring your fleets near the enemy cities to offer battle and to strike at their infrastructure. The goal is to decimate their coastal cities and wipe out their fleet.[PARAGRAPH:1]Finally, there's the sea-lane action where the goal is to maintain a secure travel route in order to ship in more units for the war in a distant location.[PARAGRAPH:1]In reality, a large war will always involve at least some of each of the 3 in different phases. It might start with a defensive action, then you'd move to secure a sea lane to provide an invasion corridor, and finally shift over to a total offensive action. [PARAGRAPH:1]Or it might be the other way around, where you deploy your fleet to a forward position to nail the initial stack-of-doom invasion fleet and then pull back to a defensive position shortly afterwards.[PARAGRAPH:1]In all cases, there are some basic tactics to consider.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Oceanic Surveillance[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]With the Stealth Destroyer, it's critical that you cover the ocean with your own Surveillance-SD's. Each S-SD can cover 14 ocean squares, so it doesn't take that many units. Because enemy SD's can easily move beyond the range of your S-SD in a single turn, you need to either deploy enough units to cover the ENTIRE ocean or establish two picket lines far enough apart that there's no way that an enemy unit can get past your S-SD's.[PARAGRAPH:1]Between the S-SD pickets, you should seed in Attack Subs, also spaced out carefully to make sure there are no gaps. That's the only way you're going to spot the enemy subs given the disability of the S-SD's. [PARAGRAPH:1]In combination, the line should look like[PARAGRAPH:1]S [BOLD](enemy continent)[\BOLD] N[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]--SD----SD----SD----SD----SD-- [BOLD](SD line 2)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]AS----AS----AS----AS----AS-- [BOLD](AS line 2)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]--SD----SD----SD----SD----SD-- [BOLD](SD line 1)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]AS----AS----AS----AS----AS-- [BOLD](AS line 1)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[PARAGRAPH:1]S [BOLD](home continent)[\BOLD] N[PARAGRAPH:1](each [COLOR_RED]+[COLOR_REVERT][\H1][\H2] and [COLOR_RED]-[COLOR_REVERT][\H1][\H2] represents an empty ocean square)[PARAGRAPH:1]The combined 9 spaces between the SD lines means that it's impossible for enemy SD's to slip by, and the double-line of attack subs also ensure that no submarine can make it past without being stuck in at least 1 location where your own Attack Submarine can see it. The absence of an Attack Sub is also a clue that there must be at least 1 enemy sub in the vicinity, so units in the 1st line should be prepared to move up to the next line at any time.[PARAGRAPH:1]The goal is to NOT use the units in the line to make attacks and to place your own battle fleet in a position to attack only after detection of the enemy.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Attack echelon[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When attacking an enemy fleet, always check if there's SD's in the stack. If there is, send your own attack-configured Stealth Destroyers in first to engage them. Beyond that, use cruise missiles to soften up the enemy units to around 30 strength, and then send in your highest promoted MC which has Barrage. That MC will probably die, but naval warfare is about attrition - not experience. It'll soften up the fleet for follow up attacks. Then send in additional MC's until there are no units above strength ~20.[PARAGRAPH:1]At this point, it's time for the assassin SD's to enter the fray and clean up. By holding back promotions, the same group of SD's can be used to attack multiple fleets over time and they're perfectly safe sitting in the middle of the ocean as long as you eliminate enemy SD's.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Forts and airpower[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Airpower is less powerful now that nearly 1/2 of the modern AI navy can't be detected by recon, but that's why you deployed that Oceanic Surveillance network. Forts give you places to put Stealth Bombers where it can do the most good, and add to the numbers of deployed aircraft. Do NOT send in stealth bombers until the enemy jet fighters are eliminated, but they can be deadly against subs and missile cruisers.[PARAGRAPH:1]Each fort should come standard with at least 1 A-SD and 1 S-DD, to provide full coastal surveillance. Then drop in a gunpowder unit with Medic to provide healing and cover against amphib assault.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Carrier airpower[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Given the danger of parking a carrier in the middle of the ocean, and how softening up the enemy fleet can be done via cruise missiles - there isn't much of a role for carriers as before. Their job is now more specialized.[PARAGRAPH:1]Carriers should also be based in forts/frontier port cities. They can sally out 4 squares, launch air strikes, and then retreat. Rather than trying to avoid the enemy fighters, you're going AFTER them. Strike directly at the enemy carriers, and whittle down their fighters to open them up for stealth bomber strikes. That covers everything between line #1 and #2 on your surveillance net.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can then reload with fighters from a secure home port during the same turn, and be ready to sally forth again.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the assault role, carriers are a lifesaver. When an enemy city is taken, it's never taken with the airport intact so the amount of airpower available is limited. There's also no option to use nearby cities to provide extra air cover if this is the beachhead. Support the ocean crossing with carriers, and you can park as many fighters in the conquered city as you want. Then every available slot can be used for Stealth Bombers. [PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Submarine shuttle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unless you plan to use tactical nukes, regular submarines are mainly useful in finding other subs and bringing cruise missiles to bear. Like regular land units in transports, missiles can be transferred from subs to MC's. That will help fleets to keep a full inventory of cruise missles without coming off their forward-deployed stations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Since the surveillance pickets are keeping an eye open for any intruding units, the submarine carrying missiles to the front should have a secure journey, doubly so if the MC move back enough spaces to shorten the journey.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Convoy Escort[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When escorting convoys, you need a BIG fleet unless your sea superiority is so complete that the AI navy is completely decimated. But given production advantages, that's unlikely. In general, a convoy's escorting fleet units should reflect how many turns the fleet will be in transit.[PARAGRAPH:1]MC's = (# turns) x3[NEWLINE]SD's = (# turns) x2[NEWLINE]DD's = (# turns) x1[NEWLINE]Carriers = 3 minimum[PARAGRAPH:1]That's a lot of ships but you should need 1 escort fleet per ocean and you can use it to escort 4 or 25 transports.[PARAGRAPH:1]I consider the "typical" crossing to be 3 turns, landing the army on the 3rd turn. That means a fleet of 9 MC's, 6 SD's, 3 DD's and 3 carriers. [PARAGRAPH:1]At the start of the turn, move the carriers forward 2 spaces and send out 2 fighters to recon for large fleets. That will make sure you detect any large stacks of BB's or MC's for a detour if necessary. Next, send the DD's on a roundabout route to the targeted rendevous point. With S-DD's, you should be able to scan a 6-square wide corridor and still get the DD's to the target point. Any detected subs will be struck by air power. SD's with cruise missiles and subs with air strikes. Move your A-SD's in for the kill and then have them rejoin the fleet.[PARAGRAPH:1]As the final move of the turn, the rest of the fleet (MC, carrier, and transports) will move to the convoy station through a thoroughly sanitized area so that the AI won't know for sure you have transports coming their way. Remember that the AI's LOVE Espionage so they already know your port of embarkation. They just don't know when the transports will sail. But they will know once your transports leave port, so it's important to deny the AI precise location on your transports.[PARAGRAPH:1]Final point - the transports should hold off-shore the planned insertion point as far as possible on the final move to keep out of range of land-based air and units which might sally forth from secure ports. That means even if you have the MP's to gt within 4 squares of the coast on that turn, hold off 6-7 squares so that the transport can make a last-turn dash straight for the enemy coast.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Coastline defense[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]With cruise missiles, stealth destroyers, and air strikes - defending off-shore platforms and fishing boats are just a quick way to get your units killed. Stockpile the work boats and leave those resources unguarded. A good surveillance network will protect your off-shre resources more surely than a bunch of sentry-duty MC's or SD's.

TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [P] pour marquer la carte et fournir des infos vos coquipiers.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [P], um die Karte anzupingen und Ihren Teammitgliedern Informationen zu senden.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [P] per segnare un punto sulla mappa e fornire informazioni ai tuoi compagni di squadra...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [P] para hacer una señal en el mapa y dar información a los compañeros de equipo...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + # key] to bind the selected unit to that # key. For example: [CTRL + 3] would make it so anytime 3 is pressed, that unit is automatically selected...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + touche numrique] pour affecter l'unit slectionne cette touche. Par exemple, avec [CTRL + 3], l'unit sera automatiquement slectionne chaque fois que vous appuierez sur la touche 3.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + Zahl], um der gewhlten Einheit die Zahl zuzuweisen. Beispiel: Drcken Sie [STRG + 3] wird die entsprechende Einheit ausgewhlt, sobald Sie die 3 drcken.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + #] per assegnare l'unit selezionata al tasto #. Per esempio, premendo [CTRL + 3], ogni volta che si premer il tasto 3 quell'unit verr automaticamente selezionata...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + número] para vincular la unidad seleccionada a ese número. Por ejemplo: [CTRL + 3] hará que la unidad quede seleccionada automáticamente cada vez que se pulse el 3...

TEXT.English: While in the city screen, press [CTRL + # key] to save the production queue. This queue can be loaded in any other city by pressing the # key...
TEXT.French: Sur l'cran d'une ville, appuyez sur [CTRL + touche numrique] pour sauvegarder la file d'attente de production. Vous pourrez la reproduire dans une autre ville en appuyant sur la touche numrique correspondante.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie im Stadt-Bildschirm [STRG + Zahl], um die Produktionsliste zu speichern. Drcken Sie in einer beliebigen anderen Stadt die gewnschte Zifferntaste, wenn Sie die Produktionsliste laden mchten.
TEXT.Italian: Mentre ti trovi nella schermata cittadina, [CTRL + #] per salvare la coda di produzione. Questa coda può essere caricata in qualsiasi altra citt premendo il tasto #...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + número] en la pantalla de la ciudad para guardar la cola de producción. Se podrá cargar esa cola en cualquier otra ciudad pulsando dicho número...

TEXT.English: Press [F11] to quickly switch in and out of Globe View...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [F11] pour passer rapidement la vue du Globe.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [F11], um zur Welt-Ansicht zu wechseln.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [F11] per attivare/disattivare la visuale globale...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [F11] para entrar y salir de la Vista global...

TEXT.English: While in the city screen, you can use [LEFT ARROW] and [RIGHT ARROW] to cycle between cities...
TEXT.French: Lorsque vous êtes sur l'cran d'une ville, utilisez la [FLECHE GAUCHE] et la [FLECHE DROITE] pour parcourir les villes.
TEXT.German: Im Stadt-Bildschirm knnen Sie mit [PFEIL LINKS] und [PFEIL RECHTS] durch Ihre Stdte schalten.
TEXT.Italian: Quando sei nella schermata cittadina, puoi usare la [FRECCIA SINISTRA] e la [FRECCIA DESTRA] per scorrere le citt...
TEXT.Spanish: En la pantalla de la ciudad se pueden usar la [FLECHA IZQUIERDA] y la [FLECHA DERECHA] para pasar de una ciudad a otra...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + B] to toggle Bare Map view...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + B] pour afficher ou masquer la carte vierge.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + B], um die Kartenansicht zu aktivieren.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + B] per attivare/disattivare la visuale mappa semplificata...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + B] para activar la vista del mapa limpio...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + R] to toggle Flag Resources view...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + R] pour afficher ou masquer les ressources.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + R], um in die Ressourcen-Ansicht zu wechseln.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + R] per visualizzare/nascondere la segnalazione risorse...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + R] para activar las marcas de recursos...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + Y] to toggle Show Yields view...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + Y] pour afficher ou masquer les icones de production.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + Y], um in die Einknfte-Ansicht zu wechseln.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + Y] per visualizzare/nascondere la produzione...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + Y] para activar la vista Mostrar rendimientos...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + A] to force all units with queued orders to move...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + A] pour forcer toutes les units ayant des ordres en attente se dplacer.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + A], um alle Einheiten mit einer Befehlsliste zu bewegen.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + A] per forzare il movimento di tutte le unit con ordini in coda...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + A] para obligar a moverse a todas las unidades con órdenes en cola...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + T] to toggle the Tile Grid
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + T] pour afficher ou masquer la grille.
TEXT.German: Blenden Sie das Gelnderaster mit [STRG + T] ein/aus.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + T] per attivare la griglia delle caselle...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + T] para activar la cuadrícula.

TEXT.English: Press [ALT + Q] to retire from the game. In multiplayer this automatically gives control of your Civilization to an AI...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [ALT + A] pour abandonner la partie. En mode Multijoueur, votre civilisation est automatiquement reprise en main par l'IA.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [ALT + Q], um das Spiel zu verlassen. Im Multiplayer-Modus bernimmt nun die KI die Kontrolle ber Ihre Zivilisation.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [ALT + Q] per ritirarti dalla partita. Nel multigiocatore, il controllo della tua civilt viene automaticamente assegnato alla I.A....
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [ALT + Q] para retirarse de la partida. En el modo para varios jugadores esto le dará el control de la civilización a la IA...

TEXT.English: Press [PAUSE] to interrupt the Turn Timer...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [PAUSE] pour interrompre le chronomtre de tour.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [PAUSE], um den Runden-Timer anzuhalten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [PAUSA] per interrompere il timer del turno...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [PAUSA] para interrumpir el contador del turno...

TEXT.English: Press [SHIFT + TAB] to chat to All in multiplayer...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [MAJ + TAB] en mode Multijoueur pour parler tous les autres joueurs.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie im Multiplayer-Modus [UMSCHALTEN + TAB], um mit allen Anwesenden zu chatten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [MAIUSC + TAB] per comunicare via chat con tutti in Multigiocatore...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsad [MAYÚS + TAB] para charlar con todos en el modo multijugador...

TEXT.English: Press [ TAB ] to chat to teammates in Multiplayer...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [ TAB ] en mode Multijoueur pour parler vos coquipiers.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie im Multiplayer-Modus [ TAB ], um mit den Mitgliedern Ihres Teams zu chatten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [ TAB ] per comunicare via chat con gli alleati in Multigiocatore...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsad [ TAB ] para charlar con los compañeros de equipo en el modo multijugador...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + W] to access the Worldbuilder...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + Z] pour ouvrir l'diteur de mondes.
TEXT.German: Rufen Sie mit [CTRL + W] den Weltenbauer auf.
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + W] para acceder al creador de mundos...

TEXT.English: Press [W] or [ENTER] to cycle through your active units...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [Z] ou [ENTREE] pour parcourir les units actives.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [W] oder [EINGABETASTE], um durch Ihre aktiven Einheiten zu schalten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [W] o [INVIO] per scorrere le unit attive...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [W] o [INTRO] para pasar de una unidad activa a otra...

TEXT.English: Press [/] to scroll though active workers...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [!] pour parcourir les ouvriers actifs.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [/], um durch Ihre aktiven Bautrupps zu schalten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [/] per scorrere tra i lavoratori...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [-] (guión) para desplazarse por los trabajadores activos...

TEXT.English: Press [COMMA] and [PERIOD] to scroll though units on the same square...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [POINT-VIRGULE] et [DEUX POINTS] pour parcourir les units sur la même case.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [KOMMA] und [PUNKT], um durch die Einheiten auf einem Gelndefeld zu schalten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [,] e [.] per scorrere tra le unit che si trovano nella stessa casella...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [,] (coma) y [.] (punto) para desplazarse por las unidades que estn en la misma casilla...

TEXT.English: Press [SHIFT + ENTER] to force the turn to end...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [MAJ + ENTREE] pour forcer la fin du tour.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [UMSCHALTEN + EINGABETASTE], um die aktuelle Runde zu beenden.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [MAIUSC + INVIO] per forzare la fine del turno...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [MAYÚS + INTRO] para forzar el final del turno...

TEXT.English: Hold down the ALT key while mousing-over a plot to view the combat odds for an attack...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche ALT enfonce quand le curseur est sur une case pour connaître les chances de russite en cas d'attaque.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie ALT gedrckt und bewegen Sie die Maus ber eine Position, um Ihre Chancen im Falle eines Angriffs zu betrachten.
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto [ALT] e punta con il mouse una casella per visualizzare le probabilit di vittoria in caso di attacco...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla ALT mientras se señala una casilla con el cursor para ver las probabilidades de un ataque...

TEXT.English: To view combat odds, hold down the right mouse button on the target tile...
TEXT.French: Pour connaître vos chances en cas de combat, maintenez le bouton droit de la souris enfonc sur la case vise.
TEXT.German: Mchten Sie Ihre Kampfchancen betrachten, halten Sie die rechte Maustaste ber dem gewnschten Gelndefeld gedrckt.
TEXT.Italian: Per visualizzare le probabilit di vittoria di uno scontro, tieni premuto il pulsante destro del mouse su una casella bersaglio...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener el cursor encima de la casilla objetivo para ver las probabilidades del combate...

TEXT.English: Press [HOME] and [END] to cycle through your cities...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [ORIG] et [FIN] pour parcourir vos villes.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [POS1] und [ENDE], wenn Sie durch Ihre Stdte schalten mchten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [HOME] e [FINE] per scorrere le tue citt...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [INICIO] y [FIN] para pasar de una ciudad a otra...

TEXT.English: Press [INSERT] to open up the nearest friendly city...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [INSER] pour ouvrir l'cran de la ville allie la plus proche.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [EINFG], um einen Blick auf die nchstgelegene verbndete Stadt zu werfen.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [INS] per aprire la schermata della citt alleata più vicina...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [INSERT] para abrir la ciudad amistosa más cercana...

TEXT.English: Hold down the [SHIFT] key to add items to the end of your city's build queue...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [MAJ] enfonce pour ajouter des lments la file d'attente d'une ville.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [UMSCHALTEN] gedrckt, um am Ende der Bauliste Ihrer Stadt weitere Objekte hinzuzufgen.
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto [MAIUSC] per aggiungere degli oggetti in fondo alla coda di costruzione della tua citt...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla [MAYÚS] para añadir elementos al final de la cola de construcción de la ciudad...

TEXT.English: Hold down the [CTRL] key to insert items at the beginning of your city's build queue...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [CTRL] enfonce pour insrer des lments au dbut de la file d'attente d'une ville.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [STRG] gedrckt, um am Anfang der Bauliste Ihrer Stadt weitere Objekte hinzuzufgen.
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto [CTRL] per aggiungere degli oggetti all'inizio della coda di costruzione della tua citt...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla [CTRL] para insertar elementos al principio de la cola de construcción de la ciudad...

TEXT.English: Hold down the [ALT] key to have a city build an item indefinitely...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [ALT] enfonce pour que la ville construise indfiniment l'lment choisi.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [ALT] gedrckt, um das gewnschte Objekt unbegrenzt zu bauen.
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto [ALT] per fare in modo che una citt costruisca un oggetto all'infinito...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla [ALT] para hacer que la ciudad construya un elemento indefinidamente...

TEXT.English: Press the forward and back buttons on your mouse to cycle through units on the same plot...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur le bouton Suivant et Prcdent de votre souris pour faire dfiler les units stationnes sur la même case.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie die Vorwrts-/Rckwrts-Tasten Ihrer Maus, um durch alle Einheiten auf einem Gelndefeld zu schalten.
TEXT.Italian: Premi i pulsanti su e giù sul mouse per scorrere le unit sulla stessa casella...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsad los botones de adelante y atrás del ratón para pasar de una unidad a otra en la misma casilla...

TEXT.English: Hold down the [CTRL] key and spin the mouse-wheel to cycle through units on the same plot...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [CTRL] enfonce et utilisez la molette de la souris pour parcourir les units sur la même case.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [STRG] gedrckt und schalten Sie mit dem Mausrad durch alle Einheiten auf dem gewnschten Gelndefeld.
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto il tasto [CTRL] e usa la rotellina del mouse per scorrere tra le unit sulla stessa casella...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla [CTRL] y girar la rueda del ratón para pasar de una unidad a otra en la misma casilla...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + M] to toggle the music on and off...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + VIRGULE] pour activer ou dsactiver la musique.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + M], um die Musik ein- oder auszublenden.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + M] attivare e disattivare la musica...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + M] para encender o apagar la música...

TEXT.English: Move units to a distant tile by right-clicking on it...
TEXT.French: Pour dplacer les units vers un endroit loign, cliquez dessus avec le bouton droit.
TEXT.German: Per Rechtsklick schicken Sie Ihre Einheiten auf das gewnschte Gelndefeld.
TEXT.Italian: Muovi le unit su una casella lontana cliccandoci sopra con il pulsante destro...
TEXT.Spanish: Se pueden mover unidades a una casilla lejana haciendo clic derecho en ella...

TEXT.English: You can group move all units of the same type by a [CTRL + RIGHT-CLICK] on the destination...
TEXT.French: Pour regrouper et dplacer toutes les units du même type, appuyez sur [CTRL] et faites un [CLIC DROIT] sur la destination.
TEXT.German: Mit [STRG + RECHTSKLICK] schicken Sie alle Einheiten eines Typs zum gewnschten Gelndefeld.
TEXT.Italian: Puoi muovere un gruppo di unit dello stesso tipo con [CTRL + PULSANTE DESTRO] sulla destinazione...
TEXT.Spanish: Se pueden mover en grupo todas las unidades del mismo tipo pulsando [CTRL + CLIC DERECHO] en el lugar de destino...

TEXT.English: You can group move all units on the same tile by a [ALT + RIGHT-CLICK] on the destination...
TEXT.French: Pour regrouper et dplacer toutes les units sur la même case, appuyez sur touche [ALT] et faites un [CLIC DROIT] sur la destination.
TEXT.German: Sie knnen alle Einheiten eines Feldes mit [ALT + RECHTSKLICK] auf die gewnschte Position bewegen.
TEXT.Italian: Puoi muovere un gruppo di unit sulla stessa casella con [ALT + PULSANTE DESTRO] sulla destinazione...
TEXT.Spanish: Se pueden mover en grupo todas las unidades de la misma casilla pulsando [ALT + CLIC DERECHO] en el lugar de destino...

TEXT.English: Enter "Go-To" Mode by pressing [G]...
TEXT.French: Pour activer le mode "Aller vers", appuyez sur [G].
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [G], um den "Gehe zu"-Modus zu aktivieren.
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [G] para entrar en el modo "Ir a"...

TEXT.English: Enter "Go-To (Same Unit Type)" Mode by pressing [CTRL + G]...
TEXT.French: Pour activer le mode "Aller vers (même type d'unit)", appuyez sur [CTRL + G].
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + G], um den "Gehe zu"-Modus fr alle Einheiten eines Typs zu aktivieren.
TEXT.Italian: Passa alla modalit "Vai a (unit dello stesso tipo)" premendo [CTRL + G]...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + G] para entrar en el modo "Ir a (mismo tipo de unidad)"...

TEXT.English: Enter "Go-To (All Units)" Mode by pressing [ALT + G]...
TEXT.French: Pour activer le mode "Aller vers (toutes units)", appuyez sur [ALT + G].
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [ALT + G], um den "Gehe zu"-Modus fr alle Einheiten zu aktivieren.
TEXT.Italian: Passa alla modalit "Vai a (tutte le unit)" premendo [ALT + G]...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [ALT + G] para entrar en el modo "Ir a (todas las unidades)" ...

TEXT.English: Press [C] to center the camera on the active unit...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [C] pour centrer la camra sur l'unit active.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [C], um die Kamera auf die aktive Einheit zu zentrieren.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [C] per centrare la visuale sull'unit attiva...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [C] para centrar la cámara en la unidad activa...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + C] to select all units of the same type as the active unit...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + C] pour slectionner toutes les units du même type que l'unit active.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + C], um alle Einheiten desselben Typs wie die aktive Einheit zu whlen.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + C] per selezionare tutte le unit dello stesso tipo di quella attiva...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + C] para seleccionar todas las unidades del mismo tipo que la unidad activa...

TEXT.English: Press [ALT + C] to select all units on the same tile as the active unit...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [ALT + C] pour slectionner toutes les units sur la même case que l'unit active.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [ALT + C], um die aktive Einheit und alle Einheiten auf demselben Feld auszuwhlen.
TEXT.Italian: Premi [ALT + C] per selezionare tutte le unit sulla stessa casella di quella attiva...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [ALT + C] para seleccionar todas las unidades de la misma casilla que la unidad activa...

TEXT.English: If you hold down the [SHIFT] key while clicking on the city bar, you can "select" multiple cities - allowing you to change production in multiple cities. You can also [SHIFT + RIGHT-CLICK] to set a rally point.
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [MAJ] enfonce et cliquez sur la barre des villes pour "slectionner" plusieurs villes. Vous pouvez ainsi changer leur production en une seule fois. Vous pouvez aussi dfinir un point de ralliement sur la carte en utilisant [MAJ] + [CLIC DROIT].
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [UMSCHALTEN] gedrckt und klicken Sie auf die Stadt-Leiste, wenn Sie mehrere Stdte auswhlen mchten, um die Produktion in mehreren Stdten gleichzeitig zu ndern. Mit [UMSCHALTEN + RECHTSKLICK] knnen Sie Sammelpunkte bestimmen.
TEXT.Italian: Se tieni premuto il tasto [MAIUSC] mentre clicchi sulla barra della citt, puoi "selezionare" più citt e in questo modo controllare produzioni multiple. Puoi anche usare [MAIUSC + PULSANTE DESTRO] per impostare un punto di raduno...
TEXT.Spanish: Si se mantiene pulsada la tecla [MAYÚS] mientras se hace clic en la barra de la ciudad, se pueden "seleccionar" varias ciudades, lo que permite cambiar la producción en varias de ellas. Tambin se puede usar [MAYÚS + CLIC DERECHO] para establecer un punto de concentración.

TEXT.English: If you hold down the [CTRL] key while clicking on the city bar, you will "select" all of your cities on that continent.
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [CTRL] enfonce et cliquez sur la barre des villes pour "slectionner" toutes vos villes sur le même continent.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [STRG] gedrckt und klicken Sie auf die Stadt-Leiste, wenn Sie alle Ihre Stdte des Kontinents auswhlen mchten.
TEXT.Italian: Se tieni premuto il tasto [CTRL] mentre clicchi sulla barra della citt, puoi "selezionare" tutte le citt di quel continente...
TEXT.Spanish: Si se mantiene pulsada la tecla [CTRL] mientras se hace clic en la barra de la ciudad, se "seleccionan" todas las ciudades propias en ese continente.

TEXT.English: If you hold down the [ALT] key while clicking on the city bar, you will "select" all of your cities in the world.
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche [ALT] enfonce et cliquez sur la barre des villes pour "slectionner" toutes vos villes dans le monde.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie [ALT] gedrckt und klicken Sie auf die Stadt-Leiste, wenn Sie alle Ihre Stdte weltweit auswhlen mchten.
TEXT.Italian: Se tieni premuto il tasto [ALT] mentre clicchi sulla barra della citt, puoi "selezionare" tutte le tue citt nel mondo...
TEXT.Spanish: Si se mantiene pulsada la tecla [ALT] mientras se hace clic en la barra de la ciudad, se "seleccionan" todas las ciudades propias en el mundo.

TEXT.English: Press the middle mouse button to exit the city screen...
TEXT.French: Cliquez avec le bouton central de la souris pour quitter l'cran de ville.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie die mittlere Maustaste, um den Stadt-Bildschirm zu verlassen ...
TEXT.Italian: Premi il pulsante centrale del mouse per uscire dalla schermata cittadina...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar el botón central del ratón para salir de la pantalla de la ciudad...

TEXT.English: You can give a unit consecutive orders by pressing the SHIFT key. For example, you could tell a worker to build a road and then a mine by clicking on both buttons while holding down SHIFT...
TEXT.French: Vous pouvez donner des ordres conscutifs une unit en appuyant sur la touche MAJ. Ainsi, vous pouvez ordonner un ouvrier de construire une route suivie d'une mine en cliquant sur les deux boutons correspondants tout en maintenant la touche MAJ enfonce.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie die UMSCHALT-Taste, um einer Einheit aufeinander folgende Befehle zu erteilen. So knnen Sie beispielsweise einem Bautrupp befehlen, zunchst eine Strae und anschlieend eine Mine zu bauen, indem Sie bei gedrckter UMSCHALT-Taste beide Buttons anklicken ...
TEXT.Italian: Puoi assegnare ordini consecutivi a un'unit premendo il tasto MAIUSC. Per esempio, puoi dire a un lavoratore di costruire una strada e poi una miniera cliccando su entrambi i pulsanti e tenendo premuto il tasto MAIUSC...
TEXT.Spanish: Es posible darle órdenes consecutivas a una unidad si se pulsa la tecla MAYÚS. Por ejemplo, se le puede decir a un trabajador que construya primero una carretera y luego una mina haciendo clic en esos dos botones mientras se mantiene pulsada la tecla MAYÚS...

TEXT.English: Hold down SHIFT and click on a tile to open a context menu...
TEXT.French: Maintenez la touche MAJ enfonce et cliquez sur une case pour ouvrir un menu contextuel.
TEXT.German: Halten Sie die UMSCHALT-Taste gedrckt und klicken Sie auf ein Gelndefeld, um ein Kontextmen zu ffnen ...
TEXT.Italian: Tieni premuto il tasto MAIUSC e clicca su una casella per aprire un menu contestuale...
TEXT.Spanish: Mantener pulsada la tecla MAYÚS y hacer clic en una casilla para abrir un menú contextual...

TEXT.English: The NUMPAD arrow keys can be used to jump between cities when the city screen is up...
TEXT.French: Utilisez les flches du PAVE NUMERIQUE pour passer d'une ville l'autre lorsque l'cran de ville est affich.
TEXT.German: Nutzen Sie die Pfeiltasten im ZIFFERNBLOCK, um bei geffnetem Stadt-Bildschirm zwischen den einzelnen Stdten zu wechseln ...
TEXT.Italian: Le frecce direzionali del TASTIERINO NUMERICO possono essere utilizzate per passare da una citt all'altra nella schermata cittadina...
TEXT.Spanish: Las flechas del TECLADO NUMRICO se pueden usar para pasar de una ciudad a otra en la pantalla de la ciudad...

TEXT.English: Press [\] to jump back to the last selected unit...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [\] pour revenir la dernire unit slectionne.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [#], um zur letzten gewhlten Einheit zu springen ...
TEXT.Italian: Premi [\] per tornare all'ultima unit selezionata...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [\] para volver a la anterior unidad seleccionada...

TEXT.English: Press [CTRL + TAB] to view the turn event log...
TEXT.French: Appuyez sur [CTRL + TAB] pour afficher le journal des vnements du tour.
TEXT.German: Drcken Sie [STRG + TAB], um das Rundenereignis-Log aufzurufen ...
TEXT.Italian: Premi [CTRL + TAB] per vedere il registro degli eventi...
TEXT.Spanish: Pulsar [CTRL + TAB] para ver el historial de sucesos del turno...
